io.spine.server.delivery

Class Delivery<D extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope,C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.delivery.Delivery<D,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - the type of deliverable package
    C - the type of consumer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MulticastDelivery, StandUpdateDelivery

    @Internal
public abstract class Delivery<D extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope,C>
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for the strategies to deliver the packaged items to the specific consumers.

    Operates with a pre-configured Executor to invoke the consumer methods.

    Allows to postpone the delivery of the items on per-item-per-consumer basis.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Delivery()
      Creates an instance of a delivery with a directExecutor() used for the operation.
      protected Delivery(java.util.concurrent.Executor delegate)
      Creates a delivery strategy with a specified Executor used for the operation.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldPostponeDelivery

        protected abstract boolean shouldPostponeDelivery(D deliverable,
                                                  C consumer)
        Determines whether the item delivery should be postponed for the given deliverable and consumer.

        This method must be implemented in descendants.

        Parameters:
        deliverable - the deliverable item which delivery may potentially be postponed
        consumer - the target consumer for the deliverable
        Returns:
        true, if the delivery should be postponed, false otherwise.

      • getDeliveryAction

        protected abstract java.lang.Runnable getDeliveryAction(C consumer,
                                                        D deliverable)
        Defines what should be done to deliver a given deliverable to the targetConsumer.

        Each Delivery implementation defines this behaviour depending on the type of the consumer.

        The result is defined as Runnable, as this action will be executed by a delegate Executor, according to the strategy implementation regulated by shouldPostponeDelivery() and deliverNow() methods.

        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer to deliver the item to
        deliverable - the item to be delivered
        Returns:
        the action on how to deliver the given item to the consumer.

      • consumersFor

        protected abstract java.util.Collection<C> consumersFor(D deliverable)
        Determines a collection of the consumers for the given deliverable.
        Parameters:
        deliverable - the item to deliver
        Returns:
        the collection of the consumers.

      • deliver

        @Internal
public void deliver(D deliverable)
        Passes the deliverable to the matching consumers using the executor configured for this instance of Delivery.

        The delivery of the item to each of the consumers may be postponed according to shouldPostponeDelivery(MessageEnvelope, Object) invocation result.

        Parameters:
        deliverable - the item to deliver

      • deliverNow

        public void deliverNow(D deliverable,
                       ConsumerId consumerId)
        Delivers the item immediately.
        Parameters:
        deliverable - the item, packaged for the delivery
        consumerId - the ID of the target consumer
